title: Cleekim Inn. A tale of smuggling in the '45
author: Dibdin, James C.
snippet: famous memory, and skirting the shores of theloch on the left, and the grounds of Heriot'sHospital on the right, made their way towardsone in the ancient line of houses, the few fastdisappearing remnants of which are looked downupon nowadays by that monument of bad tastein architecture, the Barclay Church.
